name: Cheque Bounce Notice
shortDescription: A Cheque is a bill of exchange payable on demand. Cheque bounce arises due to the non-payment of the amount because of the lack of account balance.
description: A Cheque is a bill of exchange payable on demand. Cheque bounce arises due to the non-payment of the amount because of the lack of account balance. A cheque bounce notice is sent for the recovery of amount.

howWeWork.heading: How to get a Cheque Bounce Notice drafted

content.title: Schedule Call with the Lawyer
content.description: Schedule Call and discuss with the Lawyer your Document drafting requirements

content.title: Get your Agreement Draft
content.description: Lawyer will deliver customized draft of the Document as per your requirement

content.title: Dedicated Lawyer Available
content.description: 60 Minutes of Talk time with the Lawyer for discussing requirements and changes in the draft

content.title: First Draft within 3 Days
content.description: First draft of the Document will be delivered within a maximum of 3 working days

content.title: Finalize Document
content.description: 2/3 Iterations per Document allowed to incorporate your suggestions/changes

content.title: Details of the drawer of cheque
content.description: The issuer of the cheque is known as drawer. This section of the notice provides the name, address and age of the drawer of the cheque.

content.title: Details of the payee
content.description: The person in whose favor the cheque is issued is known as a payee. This section of the notice provides the name, address and age of the payee of the cheque.

content.title: Particulars of the cheque
content.description: The notice provides details of the cheque number, date and amount, date of return of cheque.

content.title: Reason of cheque bounce
content.description: The reason of the cheque bounce shall be clearly stated in the notice.

content.title: Payment arrangement
content.description: A request for immediate payment of amount is made in the notice. It shall also mention section 138 of negotiable Instruments Act if applicable.

benefits.heading: Benefits of sending a Cheque Bounce Notice

content.description: It provides an opportunity to the drawer of the cheque to pay the drawee without the recourse of the court.
A legal notice acts as a warning and conveys to the other party your plan of action if the money is not paid.

faqs.question: What is Section 138 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881?
faqs.answer: According to section 138 of the Negotiable instruments Act, 1881 dishonor of cheque is an offence punishable with imprisonment for  two years or with fine which may extend to twice the amount of the cheque, or with both. The section also provides for the payee to make demand for the payment of the said amount of money by giving a notice in writing, to the drawer of the cheque.

faqs.question: What is the time limit to file a Cheque bounce case?
faqs.answer: A complaint can be filed within 30 days from the date of receipt of the demand notice by the drawer.

faqs.question: I have a cheque bounce notice; how can I get it reviewed by a Lawyer?
faqs.answer: ezyLegal can help you get your cheque bounce notice reviewed and provide you with the right legal guidance. You can upload your document and schedule your Consultation with an ezyLegal Lawyer.

faqs.question: What is the process of getting the Agreement drafted from ezyLegal?
faqs.answer: ezyLegal offers Standard and Customized Document drafts. If you chose the Customized Document option, your call will be scheduled with a Lawyer to whom you can explain your specific requirements. The first draft will be delivered within 2 working days and then you would be allowed 2-3 iterations to make changes in the draft.

faqs.question: How will the Document be delivered to me?
faqs.answer:
The Document when ready will be available on the ezyLegal website (www.ezylegal.in) in your secured Account. You will be notified on email and WhatsApp whenever a new version of the Document is uploaded. You can Log-in and View or Download the document.  
Copy of the documents delivered by ezyLegal will always be available in your ezyLegal account forever.
